title: Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first
description: When using two Eclipse windows, whenever I switch from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view or perspective, the other window comes to the front, obscuring my other application's windows.
OB: The expected behavior is that when clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window, only that window should come to the front, without affecting the positioning of other application windows.
EB: Instead, when clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window, the second window is brought to the front, overlapping my other application windows.
SR: To fix this bug, the Eclipse application should ensure that clicking on a docked view or perspective in one window does not bring the second window to the front, and instead only brings that window to the front.
